What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: separations, purifications, review of thermo and some kinetics, liquid-liquid extraction, distillation, adsorption, membrane extraction, etc.
Liquid-Liquid Separation, Diffusion through porous and non-porous membranes, distillation processes, adsorption.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: notes are very clear and posted promptly. Van Tassel is a very nice teacher and very accessible. Tests were fair at the end of the day. fair graded policy.

Weaknesses: the homework problems were very much computer/excel based which was tedious and could be pretty distant from the tests. also, the textbook explains things in a way more complicated and different way than the class, so it isn't the best resource.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: you are only taking this class if you have to, but it's a perfectly good CENG class.
